property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ (This creature is put into your mana zone tapped.) ■ While you have another fire creature in the battle zone, this creature has "speed attacker". ■ While you have another nature creature in the battle zone, this creature gets +2000 power and has "double breaker". (A creature that has "double breaker" breaks 2 shields.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: Instead of having this creature attack, you may tap it to use its {TAP} ability. {TAP} Draw 2 cards.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ Put all your Fire Birds in the battle zone on the bottom of your deck in any order. Then reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal a number of non-evolution Armored Dragons equal to the number of Fire Birds you put on the bottom of your deck. Put all non-evolution Armored Dragons you revealed into the battle zone, then put the rest into your graveyard.

property.name: Rules
Rules
property.value: {SHIELD TRIGGER} (When this spell is put into your hand from your shield zone, you may cast it immediately for no cost.) ■ Draw up to 2 cards.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ Whenever your Hunters win a battle, your opponent chooses one of their shields and returns it to their hand. ■ While this creature is tapped, your opponent's attacking creatures must attack this creature if able. {DOUBLE BREAKER} {LINK RELEASE} (When this creature leaves the battle zone, choose one of its psychic cells and return it to your hyperspatial zone and flip the rest of the cards.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ Psychic Link—At the start of your turn, if you have a Zero Kaiser in the battle zone, link it to this creature and flip this creature. ■ While this creature is tapped, your opponent's attacking creatures must attack this creature if able. (At the start of the game, psychic creatures aren't put into your deck and are put into your hyperspatial zone, and if a psychic creature is put into a zone other than the battle zone, they are returned there.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ Whenever your Hunters win a battle, your opponent chooses one of their shields and returns it to their hand. ■ While this creature is tapped, your opponent's attacking creatures must attack this creature if able. {DOUBLE BREAKER} {LINK RELEASE} (When this creature leaves the battle zone, choose one of its psychic cells and return it to your hyperspatial zone and flip the rest of the cards.)

property.name: Rules
Rules
property.value: ■ Whenever your Hunters win a battle, your opponent chooses one of their shields and returns it to their hand. ■ While this creature is tapped, your opponent's attacking creatures must attack this creature if able. {DOUBLE BREAKER} {LINK RELEASE} (When this creature leaves the battle zone, choose one of its psychic cells and return it to your hyperspatial zone and flip the rest of the cards.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ When you put this creature into the battle zone, destroy one of your opponent's creatures that has less power than it. (At the start of the game, psychic creatures aren't put into your deck and are put into your hyperspatial zone, and if a psychic creature is put into a zone other than the battle zone, they are returned there.)

alternate.name: Gaial King Dragon, Raging Dragon Lord

property.name: Rules

card.name: Gaial King Dragon, Raging Dragon Lord

property.name: Rules
Rules
property.value: Instead of having this creature attack, you may tap it to use its {TAP} ability. {TAP} Put the top card of your deck into your mana zone.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ This creature can't attack players. ■This creature can attack untapped darkness creatures.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ Look at your opponent's hand and discard a spell from it. ■ Choose one of the following: ► Put up to 2 psychic creatures that have total cost 6 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone: ► Put a darkness psychic creature that costs 10 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. (At the start of the game, psychic creatures aren't put into your deck and are put into your hyperspatial zone, and if a psychic creature is put into a zone other than the battle zone, they are returned there.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ When this creature is awakened, your opponent discards 2 cards at random from their hand. {TRIPLE BREAKER}

property.name: Rules
property.value: {DOUBLE BREAKER} ■ Awaken—If any of your Demon Commands are destroyed during a player's turn, flip this creature to its higher cost side at the end of that turn. (At the start of the game, psychic creatures aren't put into your deck and are put into your hyperspatial zone, and if a psychic creature is put into a zone other than the battle zone, they are returned there.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ When this creature is awakened, your opponent discards 2 cards at random from their hand. {TRIPLE BREAKER}

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ When you put this creature into the battle zone, search your deck. You may take an Armored Dragon from your deck, show that Armored Dragon to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck. {DOUBLE BREAKER}

property.name: Rules
Rules
property.value: ■ Search your opponent's deck. Take up to 2 cards from his deck and put them into his graveyard. Then your opponent shuffles his deck.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ Put a darkness psychic creature that costs 6 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. ■ You may destroy one of your non-psychic creatures. If you do, put a darkness psychic creature that costs 5 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. (At the start of the game, psychic creatures aren't put into your deck and are put into your hyperspatial zone, and if a psychic creature is put into a zone other than the battle zone, they are returned there.)

property.name: Rules
Rules
property.value: ■ When you put this creature, choose one of the following: ► Put up to 2 Fire Bird psychic creatures that cost 3 or less from your hyperspatial zone: ► Put a Fire psychic creature that costs 6 or less from your hyperspatial zone. (At the start of the game, psychic creatures aren't put into your deck and are put into your hyperspatial zone, and if a psychic creature is put into a zone other than the battle zone, they are returned there.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ Put a God that costs 7 or less from your graveyard or mana zone into the battle zone.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ When you put this creature into the battle zone, you may draw a card for each of your Dragons in the battle zone. {DOUBLE BREAKER}

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ When you put this creature, return a creature from your graveyard to your hand. If that creature is an evolution creature that has the same race as this creature, you may put that creature into the battle zone for no cost.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ Put one of your non-evolution creatures in the battle zone into your mana zone. If you do, choose an evolution creature in your mana zone that costs the same as or less than the number of cards in your mana zone and put it into the battle zone.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ Destroy one of your opponent's creatures that has power 5000 or less. ■ Put a Fire psychic creature that costs 10 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. (At the start of the game, psychic creatures aren't put into your deck and are put into your hyperspatial zone, and if a psychic creature is put into a zone other than the battle zone, they are returned there.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ Choose a race, then search your deck. Take 3 creatures that have the chosen race that have different names from your deck, and show them to your opponent. Shuffle your deck and put the 3 cards on the top of your deck in any order.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ Your opponent chooses one of their creatures and destroys it. ■ Put a Darkness psychic creature that costs 10 or less from your hyperspatial zone into the battle zone. (At the start of the game, psychic creatures aren't put into your deck and are put into your hyperspatial zone, and if a psychic creature is put into a zone other than the battle zone, they are returned there.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ While attacking, this creature gets +1000 power for each fire card in your graveyard. {DOUBLE BREAKER}

property.name: Rules
property.value: {SHIELD TRIGGER} (When this spell is put into your hand from your shield zone, you may cast it immediately for no cost.) ■ Search your deck. You may take up to 2 non-evolution creatures that have Aini in their name that have total cost 7 or less from your deck and put them into the battle zone tapped. Then shuffle your deck.
